doc.repnme: Telling our story : climate change - private sector solutions
doc.abstracts: Climate change is one of the biggest issues in development today. While public policy is key, the private sector must also play a leading role. IFC can help business not just meet the challenge of climate change but build opportunity by widening and deepening access to technologies and helping support good governance, policy reform, and innovation. This includes: 1) offering clean energy investments that open markets with first-of-a-kind projects demonstrating technical feasibility, attracting private financing, and encouraging supportive government policy reforms; 2) supporting local financial institutions, leveraging domestic resources that would otherwise be unavailable for clean energy investments; 3) working with governments to promote frameworks that encourage climate-friendly investments; 4) developing and promoting innovative financial products that attract greater investment in clean energy; 5) helping private sector clients to identify and respond to financial risks of climate change; and 6) finding opportunities to address both climate change and poverty reduction, such as encouraging low-cost energy efficient homes and solar lighting.
